label: AB2_cP12_205_a_c-001
title: Pyrite (FeS$_{2}$, $C2$) Structure
comments:
FeS$_{2}$ has been found in at least four forms: \begin{itemize} \item A \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_aP12_1_4a_8a-001}{triclinic ($P1$ \#1) phase}, \item A low temperature \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_oP12_29_a_2a-001}{orthorhombic pyrite phase} (Bayliss, 1977), \item The most commonly observed state, \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_cP12_205_a_c-001}{cubic pyrite ($C2$)} (this structure), and \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2_oP6_58_a_g-003}{Orthorhombic martensite ($C18$)}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 We have rewritten this page to include the original source of the data from (Brostigen, 1969).  Previously we only referenced (Bayliss, 1977).
